answerText: "Playboy Riots" [accept anything indicating a riot or protest at the premiere of The Playboy of the Western World][10] Christy Mahon beats his father in order to impress this character. Widow Quin warns Christy about her when Christy begins to fall for this daughter of the pub-owner Michael.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 2 | 13 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This event took place in response to the patricide depicted in a certain work, and was partially inflamed by Sinn Fein leader Arthur Griffith. [10] Name this event at the Abbey Theater in 1907 that protested the premiere of a play in which Christy beats his father to impress townspeople.
